title: Jake Paul Wins Against Chavez Jr., Eyes Bigger Boxing Challenges
snippets: YouTuber-turned-boxer Jake Paul outpoints 39-year-old former middleweight champion Julio Cesar Chavez Jr, who barely throws a punch in the early rounds.
'I want tougher fighters, I want to be world champion,' Paul said in his challenge to former and current WBC champions.

Jake Paul's unlikely rise through the ranks in boxing continued with a unanimous decision win over former WBC middleweight champion Julio Cesar Chavez Jr. on Saturday night in Anaheim, California, saying afterward that he wants "to be a world champion."

title: Serbia Protests Escalate, Call for Early Elections Amid Clashes
snippets: President Aleksandar Vucic - populist and close to Russia - has faced months of protests and alleges a foreign coup plot.
Clashes come as tens of thousands turn out for student-led protests calling for early parliamentary elections.
The student-led protest in Belgrade follows months of nationwide rallies against President Aleksandar Vucic's government, with organizers threatening to launch a civil disobedience campaign.
titles: Serbia police clash with anti-government protesters in Belgrade
Serbian police arrest dozens in clashes with antigovernment protesters
Serbia: Police clash with anti-government demonstrators
Dozens detained after Serbian riot police and anti-government protesters clash
summary: In Serbia, President Aleksandar Vucic, known for his populist stance and close ties to Russia, is facing significant opposition through months of protests, including a large student-led demonstration in Belgrade calling for early parliamentary elections. The protests, sparked by dissatisfaction with Vucic's government, have escalated to the point where organizers are threatening a civil disobedience campaign. Recent clashes between protesters and police have been reported, highlighting the growing tension in the country.
constructiveness_reason: This story provides useful context about the political situation in Serbia, the reasons for the protests, and the potential implications. It increases awareness about a current global issue, although it doesn't report on any solutions or progress being made to resolve the situation.

title: "Strike Kills 11 Near Displaced Persons' Tents; Israeli Attack on Tehran Prison
snippets: Hospital staff and witnesses said at least 11 people were killed after a strike near tents housing displaced people on Friday.

title: Serbia's President Retains Power Amid Protests; Hungary Sees Major Pride Ban Ral
snippets: Marchers gambled with potential police intervention and fines to participate in the annual Budapest Pride, which was outlawed by a law passed by Prime Minister Viktor Orbán's right-wing governing party.
A giant crowd throngs the Hungarian capital, championing LGBT rights and defying PM Viktor Orban.
Tens of thousands of people marched in the streets of the Hungarian capital despite police banning the event. Attendees risk a fine and organizers could face a one-year prison sentence.
